external_references.description: Perez, D. et al. (2021, May 27). Re-Checking Your Pulse: Updates on Chinese APT Actors Compromising Pulse Secure VPN Devices. Retrieved February 5, 2024.

objects.description: [APT5](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1023) has used the Task Manager process to target LSASS process memory in order to obtain NTLM password hashes. [APT5](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1023) has also dumped clear text passwords and hashes from memory using [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) hosted through an RDP mapped drive.(Citation: Mandiant Pulse Secure Update May 2021)
